entries.event: Born on November 11th in Moscow, Russia
Born
Fyodor Mikhailovich Dostoevsky was born on November 11th (Old Style) or January 23rd (New Style), in Moscow, Russia
Born
He knew the Gospel from a very young age.
Purchased estate in the Kashirsky District of the Tula Governorate
Sent to a French boarding school and then to the Chermak boarding school
Mother died
His most cherished childhood memories were reciting prayers in front of guests and reading passages from the Book of Job that impressed him while 'still almost a child'.
Dostoyevsky's father Fyodor was imprisoned for two years due to his involvement with a radical group
Attended the University of Saint Petersburg to study law and philosophy
Father's death on 16 June 1839
First known affair with Avdotya Panaeva
He attended Sunday liturgies from an early age.
Took a job as a lieutenant engineer on 12 August 1843
Published first literary work in journal Repertoire and Pantheon
Dostoevsky graduated from the Saint Petersburg Engineering Academy and began working as an engineer
Completed first novel 'Poor Folk'
First novel published
joined the utopian socialist Beketov circle
joined the Petrashevsky Circle, a social reform group
secret revolutionary society within the circle was created by Nikolay Speshnev
Arrested for participating in a revolutionary society and sentenced to death
Arrested for belonging to the Petrashevsky Circle
first parts of 'Netochka Nezvanova' were published
joined the vsky Circle
Committed to death, but sentence commuted
served four years of exile with hard labour at a katorga prison camp in Omsk, Siberia
Epilepsy
Released from prison after serving three years of his sentence
Released from Siberian prison camp after four years
released from prison on 14 February
moved to Semipalatinsk around mid-March
Sent a letter through Wrangel to General Eduard Totleben, leading to being granted the right to publish books and marry
Married Maria Dmitrievna Isaeva in Kuznetsk on February 7th
He took part in annual pilgrimages to the St. Sergius Trinity Monastery.
Romance with comic actress Aleksandra Ivanovna Schubert
Released from military service due to deteriorating health and granted permission to return to European Russia, first to Tver and then to St Petersburg
Affair with Russian-born woman Martha Brown (n√©e Elizaveta Andreyevna Chlebnikova)
Mock execution
Completed A Writer's Diary, a collection of his writings
Met Anna Korvin-Krukovskaya
A deacon at the hospital gave him religious instruction.
t
Married Anna Grigorievna Snitkina
February 15: Married Anna Snitkina in Trinity Cathedral, Saint Petersburg
April 14: Began delayed honeymoon in Germany with the money gained from the sale of his book Crime and Punishment
Anna's death in childbirth
Wrote the first 100 pages of The Idiot in 23 days
Fyodor Dostoyevsky's daughter Sofya was born in Geneva
Sofya died of pneumonia three months after birth
Divorced his second wife, Maria Isayeva
January: The 'Dostoevsky Publishing Company' was founded with Anna's help
Anna returns to Staraya Russa with the children, while Dostoyevsky stays in St Petersburg
June 11: Dostoyevsky is taken to court for citing Prince Meshchersky's words without permission
March 23: Dostoyevsky is taken to court again for violating copyright laws
Dostoyevsky leaves The Citizen due to stressful work and interference from the Russian bureaucracy in March
August 10: Alexey, Dostoyevsky's son, is born in Staraya Russa
Dostoevsky continues work on his Diary and receives many letters from readers
Four epileptic seizures
Russo-Turkish War began
Received an honorary certificate from the Russian Academy of Sciences
Diagnosed with early-stage pulmonary emphysema
Died due to complications from a heart attack at the age of 59
Died
